    • Method Detail

      • createTokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory

        public io.reactivex.Observable<TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory> createTokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory(UnresolvedTokenId unresolvedTokenId,
                                                                                                                          java.math.BigInteger restrictionKey,
                                                                                                                          java.math.BigInteger restrictionValue,
                                                                                                                          TokenRestrictionType restrictionType)
        Description copied from interface: TokenRestrictionTransactionService
        Create a TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory object that can be used to create or update a token global restriction.

        This service checks the current global restriction value using rest and set the corresponding previousRestrictionType and previousRestrictionValue so an update can be performed.

        When using aliases, the service will resolve them in order to query the token restriction rest endpoint. This could add some overhead. If you know the real token id, it's recommended to use it.

        Specified by:
        createTokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory in interface TokenRestrictionTransactionService
        Parameters:
        unresolvedTokenId - the token id or an alias. If an alias is sent, the service will resolve it in order to retrieve the current global restriction value.
        restrictionKey - Restriction key
        restrictionValue - New restriction value
        restrictionType - New restriction type
        Returns:
        TokenGlobalRestrictionTransactionFactory of the transaction ready to be announced.

      • createTokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory

        public io.reactivex.Observable<TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory> createTokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory(UnresolvedTokenId unresolvedTokenId,
                                                                                                                            java.math.BigInteger restrictionKey,
                                                                                                                            UnresolvedAddress unresolvedTargetAddress,
                                                                                                                            java.math.BigInteger restrictionValue)
        Description copied from interface: TokenRestrictionTransactionService
        Create a TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory object that can be used to create or update a token address restriction.

        This service checks the current address restriction value using rest and set the corresponding previousRestrictionValue so an update can be performed.

        When using aliases, the service will resolve them in order to query the token restriction rest endpoint. This could add some overhead. If you know the real token id and target address, it's recommended to use them.

        Specified by:
        createTokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory in interface TokenRestrictionTransactionService
        Parameters:
        unresolvedTokenId - the token id or an alias. If an alias is sent, the service will resolve it * in order to retrieve the current token address restriction value.
        restrictionKey - Restriction key
        unresolvedTargetAddress - the target address or an alias. If an alias is sent, the service will resolve it in order to retrieve the current token address restriction value.
        restrictionValue - New restriction value
        Returns:
        TokenAddressRestrictionTransactionFactory object without previous restriction data
